title: IMF Approves $880 Million for Ukraine With US Assistance Stalled
description: The International Monetary Fund has approved the next disbursement to Ukraine within a $15.6-billion loan program, a move that bolsters the nation’s finances as aid from the US, its key ally, remains stalled.

title: Indicted Senator Bob Menendez Teases Independent Reelection Bid
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey said Thursday that he hoped to seek reelection as an “independent Democrat” if he is exonerated of federal corruption charges, but ruled out running in the Democratic primary.

title: Mexico to Offer Venezuelans Jobs, $660 Stipend to Return Home
description: Mexico said it will provide jobs and a $660-dollar stipend to Venezuelans who agree to return to their homeland as part of a joint effort to reduce migration.

title: 270,000 Overdose Deaths Thrust Fentanyl Into Heart of US Presidential Race
description: How Trump and Biden address a lethal chapter of the US drug-overdose epidemic will be pivotal in swing states that are likely to decide the election

title: Biden’s LNG-Permit Halt Challenged by 16 States in Lawsuit
description: Texas, Louisiana and more than a dozen other US states challenged the Biden administration’s suspension of new licenses to export natural gas via ocean-going tankers.

title: TikTok Achieves Rare Feat of Uniting Republicans and Democrats
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Big Take DC senior producer Naomi Shavin gives a look at our podcast about TikTok and Congress. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Germany Pledges €300 Million for Czech Ammunition Plan
description: Germany has pledged to spend €300 million ($326 million) as part of a Czech-led initiative to buy 800,000 rounds of ammunition for Ukraine, according to people familiar with the decision.

title: EU Agrees to Start Talks With Bosnia in Latest Enlargement Push
description: European Union leaders agreed to open membership talks with Bosnia-Herzegovina as the bloc seeks to pull a divided Western Balkan country closer into its orbit to counter growing Russian influence.

title: EU Is Set to Impose Punitive Tariffs on Russian Grain
description: The European Union is set to propose punitive tariffs on the imports of some Russian agricultural products as early as Friday, a move that should all but halt trade of the restricted items destined for the bloc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: BlackRock Says ‘Reckless’ Texas Divestment Is Bad for Schools
description: BlackRock Inc. criticized Texas’s decision to divest $8.5 billion from the asset manager’s funds, calling the move “reckless” and detrimental to the finances of the state’s schools and families.

title: Catalan Pariah Returns to Spain With Plans to Take Power Again
description: Carles Puigdemont, the Catalan separatist who led a failed attempt to break away from Spain, is bidding to make a return as regional president.

title: Xi to Meet With US Executives in Beijing Next Week, WSJ Says
description: China’s President Xi Jinping plans to meet with a number of US business chiefs next week in conjuction with an annual forum in Beijing, according to the Wall Street Journal.

title: Mutual Fund Investments in Chinese Firms Targeted in New US Bill
description: US mutual funds wouldn’t be able to invest in some products that track Chinese stock indexes under a new bill in Congress.

title: Cash-Strapped Trump Badly Trails Biden in 2024 Money Race
description: Donald Trump has an enthusiastic base and a polling advantage in swing states. He does not have anywhere near the amount of money as his rival, President Joe Biden.

title: Biden Agrees to Ban LGBTQ Pride Flags at US Embassies in Deal
description: President Joe Biden agreed to ban US embassies from flying the LGBTQ pride flag as part of a $1.2 trillion spending deal to keep most US government agencies open through Sept. 30.

title: German Far Right Loses Support Amid Resistance, Insurgent Party
description: Germany’s far-right AfD lost support nationwide as it confronted public resistance and an insurgent party that’s focused on criticizing immigration as well as the country’s support for Ukraine’s war effort.

title: France Votes Against Ratifying EU-Canada Free-Trade Agreement
description: The French Senate voted against ratifying the European Union’s free-trade deal with Canada, a political setback for President Emmanuel Macron that means the accord will remain in force only provisionally.

title: New Tory Defection Shows Sunak Losing Grip on Johnson Coalition
description: The Conservative mayoral candidate for Greater Manchester defected to the upstart Reform UK party, in the latest sign that Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is losing support in areas crucial to the Tories’ victory in the last general election.

title: Row Over Ghana’s Anti-LGBTQ Bill Stalls Appointment of Ministers
description: Ghana’s parliament is stalling the approval of new cabinet ministers to put pressure on President Nana Akufo-Addo to take a decision on an anti-LGBTQ bill that requires his assent to become law.

title: Algeria to Hold Presidential Elections on Sept. 7, APS Says
description: Algeria will hold “early” presidential elections on Sept. 7, the state-run APS news agency said, citing a decision by incumbent Abdelmadjid Tebboune.

title: Canada Plans to Cut Temporary Residents by 20% Over Three Years
description: Canada, a country that’s relying heavily on immigration as an economic driver, is scaling back on its ambitions with a planned reduction in temporary residents after the influx exacerbated housing shortages.

title: Who Are the Sikh Separatists India Is Accused of Plotting Against?
description: US prosecutors are accusing an agent of India’s government of directing a plot to assassinate a US citizen of Sikh faith who sought an independent Sikh state. That plot, in New York, was thwarted. But around the same time, an associate of the would-be victim was killed in British Columbia, prompting a public accusation of India’s involvement by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada and vigorous denials from India. An Indian investigation into the US claims found that rogue operatives not autho

title: Modi’s Party Wins Biggest Donations From Megha, Aditya Birla
description: India’s Election Commission released new information Thursday showing the ruling party’s biggest donors under a now-banned political financing tool.

title: India Opposition Says Modi Rival Arrested Weeks Before Polls
description: A key opposition leader in India, and the chief minister of the capital Delhi, was arrested by the country’s federal anti-money laundering agency, his party said, just weeks before national elections.

title: Trudeau Faces Rising Political Pressure to Abandon a Key Climate Policy
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s signature environmental policy – an escalating tax on pollution – is increasingly under attack, as higher living costs erode public support for a measure the government sees as essential to curbing Canada’s emissions.

title: US Rallies Support at UN to Align ‘Safe’ AI Systems Globally
description: The United Nations General Assembly approved a resolution to promote “safe, secure and trustworthy” artificial intelligence systems, one of the most high-profile efforts yet to establish global standards for the rapidly rising disruptive technology.

title: Elizabeth Warren Renews Calls for SEC Probe of Tesla Governance
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren again urged US securities regulators to investigate whether Tesla Inc.’s board violated rules governing the independence of company directors.

title: SMIC ‘Potentially’ Broke Law If It Made Huawei Chip, US Says
description: Chinese chipmaker Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. “potentially” broke American law if it manufactured a processor for sanctioned telecom giant Huawei Technologies Co., a senior US official said.

title: Yellen Hearing Foreshadows Tax Policy Battle as Cuts Expire
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen testified Thursday at a congressional hearing that presaged a partisan battle over tax policy in the coming election, with sweeping reductions set to expire at the end of next year.

title: US Backs $50 Billion Bond for Ukraine Using Frozen Russia Assets
description: The US proposed to its Group of Seven allies that they create a special purpose vehicle to issue at least $50 billion of bonds backed by the profits generated by frozen Russian sovereign assets and use the proceeds to support Ukraine, according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Simon Harris Becomes Front Runner to Be the Next Irish Premier
description: Simon Harris became the front runner to become Ireland’s next premier after the country’s minister for public expenditure, Paschal Donohoe, announced that he wouldn’t stand in the leadership race.

title: Greece Ups Golden Visa Investment Sum Amid Housing Pressure
description: The Greek government plans to increase the minimum amount that potential foreign property buyers must pay to secure a Golden Visa, citing pressure on the country’s house purchase and rental market.

title: An Irish Goodbye: Varadkar's Legacy And Starmer's Race Problem
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: NY Poised to Seize Trump Westchester Assets If Fraud Fine Is Unpaid
description: New York state’s $454 million judgment against Donald Trump in a civil fraud lawsuit was formally registered in Westchester County just outside Manhattan, a sign that his properties in the area may be at risk of being seized if the former president fails to post an appeal bond.

title: Israel Says It Will Invade Rafah No Matter What The US Says
description: A top Israeli official said his country’s military is ultimately going to invade the southern Gaza city of Rafah and defeat Hamas “even if the entire world turns on Israel, including the United States.”

title: UK Treasury’s NatWest Exit May Be Sped Up, JPMorgan Says
description: NatWest Group Plc’s proposal to allow it to buy back more shares is laying the groundwork for the British government to exit its stake sooner than expected, according to analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co.

title: Trudeau’s Budget Eyes Young Voters With Affordable Housing Push
description: Housing will be the focus of Canada’s upcoming budget, with Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland emphasizing measures to speed up construction and boost the supply of affordable homes — possibly using government land to do it.

title: Yemen’s Houthis Tell China, Russia Their Ships Won’t Be Targeted
description: The Yemen-based Houthis have told China and Russia their ships can sail through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden without being attacked, according to several people with knowledge of the militant group’s discussions.

title: US Senators Propose Speeding Up Satellite Approval Process
description: US Senators Ted Cruz and Jacky Rosen plan to introduce legislation as early as Thursday that aims to speed the regulatory process for approving new satellites that companies want to launch to space, Cruz’s office said.

title: Fast-Growing Senegal’s Democracy at Stake in Coup-Plagued Region
description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s new newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.

title: Syria Nuclear Probe Reactivated After UN Watchdog Meets Assad
description: A stalled investigation into an alleged clandestine military-nuclear facility in Syria was renewed this week, signaling President Bashar al-Assad may be ready to resolve questions about a site bombed by Israel almost two decades ago.

title: Germany Needs More Debt to Meet NATO Goal, Scholz’s Party Says
Macron’s Boxing Pose Drives Home Tough Stance on Vladimir Putin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s latest Raging Bull-style portraits are cementing the growing belligerence at the center of his political messaging.

title: IMF Warns Central Banks Must Be Free of Election-Year Political Pressures
description: Central banks must follow through on the fight against inflation and resist political pressure to cut borrowing costs, the head of the International Monetary Fund cautioned, as more than 60 nations hold elections this year, including the US, UK and India.

title: The Gulf State Rivaling China and the US in Africa
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.New from Bloomberg: Get the Year of Elections newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy, delivered periodically throughout the year.

title: Wall Street and Silicon Valley Elites Are Warming Up to Trump
description: They like disruption, and they hate President Biden’s economic policies.

title: Biden Cancels $6 Billion in Student Debt in New Round of Relief
description: President Joe Biden is forgiving nearly $6 billion in federal student debt for almost 78,000 Americans working in public service, the latest effort to deliver on one of his signature initiatives ahead of November’s general election.

title: National World Eyes Telegraph as UAE-Backed Deal Falters
description: National World Plc, the publisher behind the Yorkshire Post and other British local newspapers, has repeated its interest in buying the Telegraph after a UAE-backed bid was effectively blocked by the UK government.

title: Fear Rises of a Far-Right Election Surge in Europe
description: On this week’s In the City, former European Union Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier warns the bloc is “at a crossroad.”

title: US Urges Stronger Ties With Japan, Philippines Ahead of Summit
description: A senior US official called for a stronger trilateral relationship with Japan and the Philippines ahead of a summit between the three countries, who share growing concerns over an assertive China.

title: Suicide Bomber Attacks Afghanistan Bank, Kills Three People
description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — A suicide bomber carried out an attack Thursday at a private bank in Kandahar city in southern Afghanistan, killing at least three people and injuring 12 others, officials said.

title: Nigeria Says Cleared Valid Claims of $7 Billion Forex Backlog
description: Nigeria’s central bank has settled all valid foreign exchange backlog as it aims to stabilize the market and restore investor confidence in the economy.

title: Congress Unveils $1.2 Trillion Plan to Fund Agencies to Sept. 30
description: Congressional leaders released details of a $1.2 trillion deal to keep open most US government agencies through Sept. 30, acting just days before a Saturday deadline for a partial government shutdown.

title: Thai King’s Estranged Son Mulls Returning to Country, Post Says
description: A son of Thailand’s King Maha Vajiralongkorn has secured a government-issued identification card and a Thai passport, and now intends to move back to the Southeast Asian country after living abroad for nearly three decades, according to the Bangkok Post.

title: Europe’s Support for Ukrainian Wheat Gets Farmers Even Angrier
description: The disquiet is a challenge for European leaders as they seek to balance domestic politics with aid for Kyiv.

title: German Cannabis Legalization Uncertainty Is Spooking Investors
description: Investors in Germany’s cannabis sector are holding back and some startups risk running out of cash amid uncertainty over whether a partial legalization of the drug for recreational use will take effect as planned on April 1.

title: Russian Money, Gaza Tensions: What to Watch at the EU Summit
description: European Union leaders are gathering Thursday in Brussels at the beginning of a two-day summit with the wars in Ukraine and Gaza front and center.

title: Eight Injured in New Russian Missile Attack on Kyiv, Mayor Says
description: Eight people were injured in the first large-scale Russian missile attack on Kyiv since February, Vitali Klitschko, mayor of the Ukrainian capital, says on Telegram.

title: Malaysia King Set to Extend Powers as ‘Honorary’ Police Chief
description: Malaysia’s government is poised to make King Ibrahim Iskandar the “honorary” head of the police force, a new position that may see the monarch expanding his powers in the Southeast Asian nation.

title: Trump Trails Biden on Campaign Fundraising as Legal Fees Mount
description: Donald Trump’s political operation spent an additional $5.6 million on legal fees in February, dampening the Republican presumptive nominee’s political fundraising, which continues to lag his Democratic rival’s cash haul.

title: ‘Political Earthquake’ Shakes Up Succession Battle in Vietnam
description: Vietnam may not have the polarizing elections that divide many democratic nations, but the ouster of a second president in just over a year shows that closed-door power struggles inside the one-party state can be just as brutal.

title: In India's Hindi Heartland, Farmer Distress Isn't Holding Back Modi
description: The ruling BJP’s increasingly entrenched popularity leans heavily on rural areas — but many have seen only limited benefits from the party’s decade in power.

title: Portugal’s Center-Right Leader Named Prime Minister After Narrow Election Win
description: Portugal’s center-right leader Luis Montenegro was named prime minister after his coalition’s narrow election win this month, presenting him with the challenge of trying to govern with a minority administration.
